smart_goals.description: Exercise for 30 minutes a day to reduce stress and improve blood sugar levels.
Limit alcohol consumption to one drink per day to improve blood sugar control.
Avoid smoking to reduce the risk of complications associated with diabetes.
Monitor blood sugar levels regularly and work with healthcare provider to adjust medications as needed.
Consume a healthy diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains to manage blood sugar levels.
Learn how to properly administer insulin injections and monitor blood sugar levels.
Manage stress through relaxation techniques such as deep breathing, yoga, or meditation.
Monitor feet regularly for any signs of infection or injury and seek medical attention if necessary.
Seek support from family, friends, and healthcare professionals to manage diabetes effectively.
Stay up-to-date on the latest research and advancements in diabetes care and treatment.
